tool_description: Discover, search, and retrieve train station data with our intuitive Train Station API. Effortlessly find stations by name, get detailed information with UICCodes, and access AmtrakCode support. Simplify train station integration for your applications.
name: railway stations
title: railway stations

api_list.name: Get by AmtrakCode
api_list.description: Get details of a trainstration matching the AmtrakCode for US
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://railway-stations1.p.rapidapi.com/lookup/amtrakcode/ALX"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "railway-stations1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://railway-stations1.p.rapidapi.com/lookup/amtrakcode/{amtrakcode}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "railway-stations1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Search by Matching Name
api_list.description: Search a station by the exact name to retrieve a UICCode (EU Stations) or AmtrakCode (US Stations)
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://railway-stations1.p.rapidapi.com/lookup/StationExact/rotterdam"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "railway-stations1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Search by Name
api_list.description: Search a station by part of the name to retrieve a UICCode (EU Stations) or AmtrakCode (US Stations)

api_list.name: Get by UICCode
api_list.description: Get details of a train station matching the UICCode of EU
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://railway-stations1.p.rapidapi.com/lookup/uiccode/7011450"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "railway-stations1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
